adjectives.description: fireproof (comparative more fireproof, superlative most fireproof)

examples: The fireproof safe will protect documents inside for up to four hours in a standard house fire.

verbs.description: fireproof (third-person singular simple present fireproofs, present participle fireproofing, simple past and past participle fireproofed)

entries.meaning: To make resistant to damage from fire.
examples: I hastily fireproofed my clothing somewhat by pouring a bucket of water over myself before dashing into the flames.
